Title: Poland's Gaz-System to get $593 million loan for floating LNG terminal
Description: Polish gas grid operator Gaz-System has signed a deal to receive a PLN 2.2 billion ($590 million) loan from state-owned bank BGK to finance the onshore section of the Gdansk floating storage regasification unit-based (FSRU).
Author: JS

Title: Commonwealth LNG receives final project approval, eyes Q3 FID
Description: Commonwealth LNG has received the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission’s (FERC) final order upholding authorisation for its 9.5 mtpa LNG export project in Cameron, Louisiana, putting it on track for reaching a final investment decision (FID) in the third quarter of 2025.
Author: JS

Title: Bahrain’s Bapco floats LNG purchase tender, seeking four cargoes for August-September
Description: Bahrain’s state-owned Bapco has launched its second LNG tender this year, seeking the purchase of four cargoes for August-September, with the tender closing on June 24.
Author: JS

Title: Shell-chartered vessel en route to load LNG Canada’s first cargo
Description: The Gaslog Glasgow is set to become the first tanker to load the 14 mtpa LNG Canada LNG export project’s commissioning cargo, surpassing the previously expected Puteri Sejinang by two weeks.
Author: JS

Title: Korea's SK Group  sees strong US momentum on Alaska LNG, but warns viability Is key
Description: A top executive from South Korea’s SK Group says the US government is showing strong commitment to the $45 billion Alaska LNG project, but cautions that commercial viability remains the critical test for Asian buyers.
Author: CK

Title: Inpex aims to work towards aligning Abadi LNG FID with Indonesia’s 2026 target
Description: Japanese upstream firm Inpex is working to bring forward its final investment decision on the 9.5 mtpa Abadi LNG project in Indonesia to 2026, in line with the Indonesian government's push to accelerate development and start production by 2029.
Author: CK

Title: Shell flags shipping caution in Middle East; GPS jamming a concern
Description: Shell is taking a cautious approach to its shipping operations in the Middle East amid the Israel-Iran conflict and rising regional tensions, with particular concern around maritime safety and cyber threats.
Author: CK
